alert.note: Alert for Kemper (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 26 at 7:22PM CDT until March 26 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN KEMPER...NORTHERN CLARKE AND EASTERN LAUDERDALE COUNTIES... At 721 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Tamola to Kewanee to near Increase, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. At 715 PM, trees were reported down on multiple homes in Lauderdale County. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Lauderdale, Meridian, Meridian Station, Zero, Tamola, Increase, Toomsuba, Kewanee, Snell, Sable, Alamucha, Middleton and Sykes. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for east central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
